lexeme.note: From Scottish Natural Heritage's Faclan Nàdair.
Info: The name 'amadan-mòintich' means the fool of the moor because it is so easy to hunt and because it hangs its wing in a strange manner to attract people away from its ground-nest
Dwelly: amadan-mòintich ¶ sm Dotterel (charadrius morinellus). 2 Wigeon (anas penelope). 3(AF) Snipe (gallinago gallinago). 4(AF) Ringed plover (charadrius hiaticula).
